article_title: MAP-21: The wrong course for pension plans?
article_text:
The passage last year of the Moving Ahead for Progress in the 21st Century Act was in part aimed at helping corporate pension plans meet their funding requirements. To a point, it has, but the legislation may not have done much to slow the demise of traditional pension plans. Complete your profile to continue reading and get FREE access to BenefitsPRO.com, part of your ALM digital membership. Benefits:

According to the UBS Global Asset Management US Pension Fund Fitness Tracker, the funded status of corporate pension plans was up by a considerable margin in the second quarter of 2013, helped along by strong market performance and an increase in interest rates. But neither factor was enough, and many plans remain sorely underfunded. Fitch has already said that problems could arise down the road that would make it wiser for companies to keep the contributions coming.

article_metadata.sailthru.author: Marlene Y. Satter
article_metadata.description: The change was a godsend to companies experiencing cash flow issues, but Fitch Ratings, among others, doesn't think it's the best way to go.
